message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.MM, cs.CE 

Reasoning: 
1. cs.IT (Information Theory): The paper discusses the feasibility of using intelligent reflecting surfaces (IRS) to improve the beamforming gain and throughput of uplink communications in a massive MIMO system. This involves analyzing the channels and signal-to-interference-plus-noise ratios (SINRs) of the system, which are key concepts in information theory. 
2. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture): The paper proposes a novel zero-forcing (ZF) beamforming strategy to null the interference in the IRS-assisted massive MIMO system. This involves designing a communication protocol for the system, which falls under the scope of networking and internet architecture. 
3. cs.SY (Systems and Control): The paper discusses the challenges of using IRS in a massive MIMO system, which involves controlling the signals and channels of multiple users. This falls under the scope of systems and control. 
4. cs.MM (Multimedia): The paper discusses the throughput gain promised by theoretical analysis in a massive MIMO system, which is relevant to multimedia applications that require high data rates. 
5. cs.CE (Computational Engineering, Finance, and Science): The paper involves analyzing the performance of the proposed IRS-assisted massive MIMO system using numerical simulations, which requires computational methods and tools.
